name: Le Lagoto Resort & Spa

reviews.title: Amazing!
reviews.text: There was a wedding on at the time and the hotel was at full occupancy but it wasnt a problem at all. The staff will still set up a meal for you on the deck even if the restaurant is being used for a reception. But we just ate at the pizza shop across the road.

reviews.title: Beautiful resort - you have to stay here
reviews.text: I was tossing up between this and the Savaii Lagoon resort as they are side by side and share the same beach. But from what I could see Le Lagoto was far superior to the Savaii Lagoon although it does still rate quite highly. Admittedly I did not see inside the Savaii Lagoon rooms but from the outside they look like old fibro shacks you would find on the river in Australia. Whereas Le Lagoto has an actual resort feel to it. The deciding factor for me was that Le Lagoto had air conditioning but I was so pleased I chose as I did, there is absolutely no comparison.

reviews.title: Location is everything
reviews.text: The breakfast are a very high standard. The buffet nights were good value.

reviews.title: Lovely secluded location outstanding staff
reviews.text: We went to the restaurant next door at Savaii Lagoon and it had 3 things on the menu. Again not comparison.

description: We say that " you haven't been to Samoa unless you've been to Savai'i"Located on a secluded white, sandy beach fringed by coconut palms & crystal clear waters, we are a boutique resort which offers the modern conveniences of a large resort in an intimate, idyllic setting with amazing sunset views.
